metadata.title: CVE-2023-42117 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Exim Improper Neutralization of Special Elements Remote Code ExecutionVulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to executearbitrary code on affected installations of Exim. Authentication is notrequired to exploit this vulnerability.The specific flaw exists within the smtp service, which listens on TCP port25 by default. The issue results from the lack of proper validation ofuser-supplied data, which can result in a memory corruption condition. Anattacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context ofthe current process. Was ZDI-CAN-17554.

criterions.comment: exim4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
